data.fullContent: Miguel de Unamuno was a Spanish philosopher, poet, and writer who was born in Bilbao, Spain, on September 29, 1864. Unamuno was a professor of Greek philosophy at the University of Salamanca from 1890 to 1901. His most important work is an essay called 'Tragic Sense of Life' (1913), in which he describes his concept of 'dynamic philosophy.' Unamuno's philosophy is based on the idea that there is no human knowledge that can reach beyond one's personal knowledge, so he rejects all knowledge embodied in abstraction or universality. Instead, he sees life as a succession of episodes and experiences that are filled with intense feelings. Then, according to Unamuno, the only way people can take part in this experience is through action.

q1.translation: 米格尔·德·乌纳穆诺是西班牙哲学家、诗人和作家，他于1864年9月29日出生于西班牙毕尔巴鄂。乌纳穆诺于1890年至1901年在萨拉曼卡大学担任希腊哲学教授。他最重要的作品是一篇题为《生命的悲剧感》(1913年)的文章，其中描述了他的“动态哲学”概念。Unamuno的哲学是建立在没有任何人类知识能够超越个人知识的基础上的，所以他拒绝一切体现在抽象或普遍性上的知识。

Unamuno's philosophy is based on the idea that there is no human knowledge that can reach beyond one's personal knowledge, so he rejects all knowledge embodied in abstraction or universality.

q2.translation: 米格尔·德·乌纳穆诺是西班牙哲学家、诗人和作家，他于1864年9月29日出生于西班牙毕尔巴鄂。乌纳穆诺于1890年至1901年在萨拉曼卡大学担任希腊哲学教授。他最重要的作品是一篇题为《生命的悲剧感》(1913年)的文章，其中描述了他的“动态哲学”概念。Unamuno的哲学是建立在没有任何人类知识能够超越个人知识的基础上的，所以他拒绝一切体现在抽象或普遍性上的知识。相反，他认为生活是一系列充满强烈情感的事件和经历。乌纳穆诺认为，人们参与这种体验的唯一方式就是行动。
